medical_history.chief_complaint: Goiter and bilateral progressive sensorineural hearing impairment.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The elder sister presented with an elevated TSH level at newborn screening, later developed subclinical hypothyroidism, childhood-onset goiter, and progressive hearing impairment. The younger sister was born with a palpable goiter, experienced elevated free T3 and T4 concentrations, and developed hearing impairment requiring cochlear implants at 2 years.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The elder sister has a history of suspected Pendred syndrome, characterized by goiter and hearing loss. The younger sister has been diagnosed with both Pendred syndrome and resistance to thyroid hormone.
medical_history.family_history: The father reported unilateral severe hearing impairment since birth. The mother is healthy and the third child is healthy with normal hearing.
